story: Marge begged her husband Bill for a backyard pool. He finally relented, and the pool was installed. Soon, Marge was throwing weekly pool parties. At one party, she saw a curvy neighbor in a bikini talking to Bill.
choice1: Marge put a new key on her keychain.
choice2: Marge felt a pang of regret about putting in the pool right then.

story: Andy has been mowing lawns in his town since he was five. Recently, Andy wanted to become a bit more financially independent. Andy decided that he should open his own landscaping business. Andy figured this would help him to achieve his financial goal.
choice1: Andy was excited to announce the opening of his landscaping business.
choice2: Unfortunately, Andy realized that he hated landscaping and decided to instead pursue a career in underwater basket weaving.

story: Megan and I walked home from school near a busy street. I saw three blue cars pass by in a row. We decided to count the blue cars. Megan and I sat on the curb all afternoon.
choice1: After counting the cars, we went back home.
choice2: We then sat down and began to count the cars,

story: Johnny used to pee in swimming pools  as a kid. He thought he could do it as an adult. He took his kids to a water park. Next he peed in the wading pool.
choice1: Some people noticed and Johnny got in trouble.
choice2: Everyone was really happy because of Johnny's behavior.

story: Sean's roommates notice that his clothes and bed start to smell. They tell him he needs to clean his laundry pretty soon. Sean protests at first, but finally he cleans his laundry. His roommates are grateful that Sean no longer smells as bad.
choice1: Sean's roommates got very angry that he wasn't listening.
choice2: They tell him to never wait so long to do laundry again.

story: Pam and Tom's baby was a light sleeper. Their thoughtless neighbor often left his dog outside barking all day. Every time Pam got her baby to sleep, the dog started barking. Pam fantasized about unleashing the dog so it would run away.
choice1: One night, Pam let her cats inside her home.
choice2: One night, Pam decided to release the dogs.

story: I went to the zoo. I really wanted to see lions. I walked for an hour. I could not find them.
choice1: I finally found the lion exhibit in the back of the zoo.
choice2: I decided to give up on finding the lions and went home disappointed.

story: Jess hated egg salad. When her friend's mother served it, she knew she had to eat it. Just as she was about to take a bite the family dog walked by. No one was looking so she lowered it towards the dog.
choice1: The dog happily ate the salad.
choice2: Jess decided to make egg salad.

story: My sister in law had only four teeth. She did not see a dentist for Years. Last month her teeth started bothering her. She had her teeth pulled.
choice1: Now my sister-in-law has to use dentures.
choice2: Now my sister-in-law enjoys hard candy and caramel apples.

story: A bar owner put out a large banner to advertise his bar. The wind was strong and blew the banner away. The owner chased his banned across town. It landed in the backyard of an old woman.
choice1: The old woman refused to give back the banner.
choice2: The old woman was delighted to find the fur coat.

story: Neil loved Dublin! He thought the Irish capital was lively and friendly. But his favorite place was Trinity College. He saw the ancient Book of Kells on display there.
choice1: He enjoyed his stay in the country.
choice2: Neil was bored of the trip and went home.

story: Bob got a rubix cube for Christmas. He struggled to solve the puzzle. Eventually, he was able to solve half of it. But, the full solution remained elusive.
choice1: Bob worked hard and then finally solved the puzzle.
choice2: Bob then gave up on the video game.

story: The Brown family was going to the Grand Canyon. They all piled in the car and began their drive from Iowa. There were many stops along the way and the trip was long. When they arrived at the Canyon the kids hopped out of the car.
choice1: They walked all the way back home in disgust and anger.
choice2: They all took photo's to post on their Facebook pages.

story: James had an Xbox 360. His friends had Xbox accounts online. James registered, but was still unable to connect online. He called for tech support, but they couldn't help either.
choice1: He realized he would need a new Xbox.
choice2: James gave up on playing Xbox and decided to switch to outdoor activities instead.

story: Tom heard a strange noise in the attic. He went upstairs to see what it was. He saw a glowing, transparent person. They made a spooky gesture towards him.
choice1: He ran away to tell his wife he'd seen a ghost.
choice2: He decided to have a conversation with the ghost and ended up becoming possessed.

story: Jack was playing baseball in a field near his home. When it was his turn to bat he swung with all his might. He was shocked to see the ball fly past the field. The ball broke the window on his bedroom.
choice1: Jack swallowed the ball.
choice2: Jack was shaken up.

story: It was a wet rainy day. Joel forgot to take off his shoes at the door. His shoes tracked mud throughout the house. Joel's mom saw the mud.
choice1: She was fine and mopped up the mud.
choice2: She yelled at Joel.

story: Tyler wanted a new computer. However, none of the computers available to buy fit his desires. So, he decided to build one himself. He ordered all the parts and got to work.
choice1: Tyler was a dog.
choice2: Tyler was computer literate.

story: Bailey had been an avid roller derby fan. She longed for the day she could be on a team. Recently, Bailey saw a flyer for roller derby team auditions. Bailey decided she would sign up for the team auditions.
choice1: Bailey was excited to audition for the roller derby team.
choice2: Bailey realized she couldn't skate and decided to give up her dream of becoming a roller derby player.

story: Sarah was getting really nervous. She had a soccer game today. She went out on the field to do her best. Unfortunately, her nerves impacted her performance.
choice1: Her team lost and Sarah was highly upset about it.
choice2: The other team lost and Sarah rubbed it in their faces.

story: Ed went to the local chicken restaurant. He ordered a bucket of chicken to eat. When he got home he noticed it wasn't what he had ordered. It was all wings and thighs when it was supposed to be breasts.
choice1: Ed called the restaurant and complained.
choice2: Ed called the restaurant and complimented them for their service.

story: John liked a girl at his work. He tried to get her attention by acting silly. She told him to grow up. John confesses he was trying to make her like him more.
choice1: John was happy about being rejected.
choice2: The girl found this charming, and gave him a second chance.

story: My friend texted me, wanting to hang out Friday night. When I tried to contact her on Friday, I got no reply. Despite the change of plans, everything turned out great. I just needed a girls night after all.
choice1: I met up with another friend and we enjoyed ourselves.
choice2: I went out by myself and met a man, we have a date on Friday.

story: A couple of my friends took me to an arcade. In addition to playing arcade games, we played outdoor activities. This included going on floats with water guns. My friend and I tried to shoot the people on the other floats.
choice1: We won the game and received an awesome prize.
choice2: We shot a hole in the opposing float and they sank.

story: Jan had to pick up her daughter after class. In a hurry, she drove to school in housecoat and slippers. Jan waited in the car for her daughter, who didn't show up. Worried, Jan went to the door of the class to find her daughter.
choice1: Then she realized it was Saturday.
choice2: And saw the biggest bear she had ever seen.

story: Kennan was born with a proprioceptive disorder. His mom had a hard time explaining to his brother what that meant. Because Kallen didn't understand, the boys fought a lot. This made things very hard for the family.
choice1: The parents wished their three daughters would get along better.
choice2: They considered seeing a family counselor to help with everything.

story: Aurelia was given an ice cream maker for her birthday. She had never thought of making nice cream before. She gathered the ingredients for her first vanilla ice cream. Aurelia was amazed with how delicious her homemade ice cream was.
choice1: She began brainstorming a new ice cream recipe.
choice2: She threw her ice cream in the garbage.

story: My wife wanted to buy a really expensive toy for our granddaughter. Unfortunately, no big toy store had the newest model in stock. She went to a boutique toy store that only catered to wealthy clients to look for the hottest toy. It was amazing and she felt like a kid again while there.
choice1: She was shocked to find a bunch of the toys in stock.
choice2: She applied for a job there.

story: Micky always wanted to get thinner. He tried fad diets to no avail. He started to cut back on his calories and get more exercise. After 2 months Micky started to see results.
choice1: He was very proud of all his hard work.
choice2: Micky was very disappointed.

story: Bob used plastic grocery bags to go shopping. Then, his friend told him that plastic is bad for the environment. Bob decided to forego his plastic bags. Bob invested in some reuseable grocery bags.
choice1: Bob used his reusable grocery bags to go shopping.
choice2: Bob continued to use his plastic grocery bags to go shopping.

story: Joey went to Disneyland with his family. He was so excited to meet Mickey Mouse. When he met Mickey Mouse he was so excited he couldn't speak! Joey finally said hi to Mickey and it was great!
choice1: Joey loved everything about Disneyland except for Mickey Mouse.
choice2: Joey had a great time.

story: One day I went outside and my dog was not there. I panicked. I had no idea where she was. Suddenly, my neighbor called me from next door.
choice1: The neighbor had my dog.
choice2: I gave my dog to the neighbor.

story: Arnold was scared of bats. He thought that if they bite him he would turn into a vampire. One day he saw a bat in his bathroom. He freaked out so much he screamed.
choice1: Arnold took a relaxing shower with the bat.
choice2: The bat flew directly toward the source of the scream.

story: Polly planted crocus bulbs with her grandmother. Grandma told her that they would bloom in early spring. There was a late snow that year. But the crocus were not to be deterred.
choice1: They bloomed right on schedule.
choice2: Polly's plants never bloomed.

story: Jill saw an infomercial for unbreakable glass cups. She was amazed and ordered them. When Jill received the cups, she wanted to test them. She dropped one on her hardwood floor.
choice1: It broke and Jill felt dumb for believing the hype.
choice2: The cloth ripped in two, much to Jill's surprise.

story: Jon felt like a bad dad. He worked so late, he often missed his kids when he came home. On the weekends, he was tired and grumpy. One Saturday, his son sat down on the couch and leaned on Jon's arm.
choice1: John went to the movies by himself.
choice2: Jon loved spending time with the kids.

story: Pamela purchased an antique urn at a garage sale. She thinks it would look nice with the decor in her home. When she got home she noticed that someone's ashes were in there. Pamela returned the urn.
choice1: Pamela received a full refund and a free urn for her troubles.
choice2: Pamela was happy about her purchase.

story: Cindy was at a restaurant. And she ordered hot soup. But the waitress forgot to tell her that the bowl was hot. So when received the bowl from the waitress, she hurt her hands.
choice1: Cindy went and ran cold water over her hands.
choice2: Cindy continued holding the soup.

story: Abby and Tammy were the best of friends. They both loved to do things together that were fun and creative. They decided to make friendship bracelets together and give to others. Abby made five and Tammy made seven more.
choice1: Tammy never spoke to Abby again.
choice2: They decided to keep the bracelets for themselves.

story: Evan complained about everything. His girlfriend started making him dinner, but he said it smelled bad. She was so offended! She left mid-cooking, leaving the meal unfinished.
choice1: She broke up with Evan.
choice2: Evan was pleased.

story: Ember went to the police academy. She did very well and graduated. Ember was hired and did well at her job. Ember solved many cases and was promoted to detective.
choice1: Ember was proud to be a firefighter.
choice2: Ember was proud of her new job and excelled at it as well.

story: Lisa began to realize that she did not enjoy studying business. She wanted to study art but was worried about making money. Finally, one day she had the courage to drop out of school. Her friends and family told her it was crazy to leave school.
choice1: Lisa still felt confident that her choice would make her happy.
choice2: Lisa got a degree in business.

story: Jill's dad took her to pick out a kitten. There were two in the cage. She couldn't leave one behind. Her dad agreed.
choice1: Jill and her dad took one kitten home.
choice2: Jill and her dad took both kittens home.

story: Jill loved Christmas time. She especially loved the presents. One Christmas, she received a new watch. She loved it so much since it was exactly what she asked for.
choice1: Jill wants to get a better watch next year for Christmas.
choice2: Jill now wears her watch every day.

story: Shane and John were best friends at school. Shane was caught stealing and got suspended from school. John was not allowed to be friends with Shane anymore. this bothered John greatly but his mom explained the reasons.
choice1: She explained that Shane shouldn't have been caught.
choice2: She explained that Shane was a bad influence on John.

story: Tom wanted to enjoy his racing games more. So he bought a racing wheel for his computer. After some struggling, he successfully set it up. And he had lots of fun using it.
choice1: Tom decided to buy more racing games to enjoy the wheel with.
choice2: Tom broke the wheel because he didn't like racing games.

story: Shay had been asked to come into the office on a Saturday. They were having a business meeting and wanted her to be there. Shay wanted her weekend off, but she agreed to come in. On payday, she saw that she had made overtime pay on that Saturday.
choice1: Shay was upset that her company had mistreated her.
choice2: Shay was happy that she went into the office.

story: Detention was finally over. The teacher had confiscated Gina's phone. She went to his desk to ask for it back. It turned out a parent needed to collect the phone.
choice1: The teacher gave Gina her phone back.
choice2: Gina's father agreed to pick up the phone for her.

story: The school received a grant to make a computer lab. Their IT department did a lot of research to find the best equipment. They bought the equipment with the grant money. The computer lab was a great success.
choice1: The government continued to fund computer labs.
choice2: Kids suffered from the computer labs.

story: Maybelle's breath always smelled like peppermints. Her house did as well, or at least that's what he remembers. To this day he keeps peppermints in his cupboards. They remind him of his grandma and what she meant to him.
choice1: He hates his grandmother.
choice2: It is a fond memory.

story: Haley heard a dog barking outside her window. She did not own a dog, and went outside to investigate the noise. The dog ran into her house and laid down on the sofa. Haley asked around to see if anyone owned the dog.
choice1: Haley decided to adopt the dog when no one claimed him.
choice2: Haley ran away from the dog and never went outside again.

story: Jacob has always loved serving people food. He loved when his parents hosted parties growing up. Jacob's passion led him to open a bistro downtown. He didn't do a good job in picking a chef to hire.
choice1: Now no one wants to eat there because the food isn't very good.
choice2: Surprisingly, Jacob's poor chef selection actually led to his bistro becoming a hit with food critics because of the unique and experimental flavors.

story: Joe was pals with Tim. They always played together at recess. One day Joe said he was going to move away. Tim was sad.
choice1: Joe and Tim stayed friends online.
choice2: Joe then punched Tim.

story: The family made it their goal to go to twenty national parks. They drove around all summer. They visited about half of their goal that year. They plan on trying again next summer.
choice1: They made a lot of memories doing it.
choice2: They got lost in a dangerous forest and never made it back home.

story: My class went to the Everglades for our field trip. We did some sightseeing in several of the forests. We also got the opportunity to travel in water. The bus ride home was long and boring.
choice1: I was invigorated when I got home.
choice2: I was tired when I got home.

story: Trisha's son got sick last night at eight. He vomited all over her and the floor. Trisha cleaned up and changed his clothes. He continued to be sick over and over again.
choice1: Trisha made the child sleep on the kitchen floor with a blanket.
choice2: Trisha let the children decorate the tree with popcorn.

story: Tim was too tall for all of his pants. He could not find a good outfit to wear for his trip to the park! Everything made his legs look too long and silly. Then he decided to cut his jeans into shorts.
choice1: Tim bought new jean-shorts at the store.
choice2: Tim wore the jean-shorts to the park.

story: For my birthday last year, I was gifted a pair of headphones. They were very expensive. I was appreciative of the gift. However a few months in, they broke in half.
choice1: All of that money was down the drain.
choice2: Expensive headphones are built to last.

story: Aya entered a contest at her grocery store. Shoppers could submit their receipts into a drawing for a new car. Aya shopped a lot, so she had a lot of entries. She hoped to win the new car!
choice1: Aya stopped shopping.
choice2: Aya waited with anticipation.

story: Adam went to the park. There he ran into a few of his friends. They invited Adam to play frisbee with them. Adam agreed.
choice1: Adam ran from the frisbee players as fast as he could.
choice2: Adam played frisbee with them.

story: Terry left the hospital frustrated and disheartened. He had trouble opening his car door with a broken thumb. At home, he asked his sister to loan him money for surgery. She agreed on the condition that he get a job with insurance.
choice1: He agreed,
choice2: Terry's sister decided to get surgery on her thumb.

story: Greg wanted to leave the city and become a pig farmer. He thought pigs were noble creatures. He thought farming was a respectable profession. Greg quit his job as a pharmacist.
choice1: Before long, he was a happy and successful pig farmer.
choice2: Greg got a job at a competing pharmacy for more money.

story: Bob went to the doctor. The doctor told him that he was overweight. Bob realized that he had to get in shape. He joined a gym and started to watch what he ate.
choice1: Bob gained 50 pounds.
choice2: Bob got in shape.

story: Sal bought a lotto ticket. The jackpot was up to 1 million dollars. He had all the numbers except 1. Sal won 5 thousand dollars.
choice1: Sal was excited to be an instant millionaire.
choice2: Sal decided to keep buying lotto tickets each week.

story: Tia wanted to make something to sell at the craft fair. She decided to make homemade soap. She made glycerin soap in a big pot on her kitchen stove. Then she pressed flower blossoms into the centers of her bars.
choice1: Tia then made pretty labels to put on each bar.
choice2: Tia used the soap bars to wash her dirty dogs.

story: Marcus was really good at science. Kids made fun of him for being a nerd. He decided to show them once and for all. He created a huge solar system with planets that were three feet fall!
choice1: All the students were impressed and stopped teasing him.
choice2: The other students didn't know who made the solar system.

story: My friends and I went to a music festival. We got to see eighty different bands. The atmosphere was like a carnival. We danced until daybreak each day.
choice1: By the end of the weekend, we were exhausted and happy.
choice2: We got so sick of the music that we left early and never want to go to a festival again.

story: Coy needed new sneakers. She went to the store and examined their selection. She settled on a lovely blue pair. And the price was just right, too!
choice1: Coy bought the sneakers.
choice2: Coy bought a more expensive pair of sneakers.

story: Alex awoke to bright sunlight. She looked at her clock alarm. She realized she must have overslept! Alex jumped out of bed.
choice1: She was late for school.
choice2: She went back to sleep.

story: A new Organic Avenue store opened up in NYC and I checked it out. I was super excited to try it because I never went before. As I walked in, they had amazing salads and juices to try. I tried a summer salad and coconut water.
choice1: I decided never to go back to that restaurant.
choice2: This was my new favorite restaurant.

story: Mike had parked his tractor in the barn. There was a bad storm and the barn collapsed. Mike's tractor was ruined. He called his insurance company.
choice1: Mike did not accept the insurance money.
choice2: Mike filed a claim on the barn and the tractor.

story: Lary was a poor coal miner. Lary would work long hours every day in the mines. Lary was mining one day and saw a sparkle in the distance! Lary had found a vein of gold ore!
choice1: Lary ignored it and kept working.
choice2: Lary was happy and excited.

story: There was a turtle in the lake. It climbed up on a rock to get into the sun. Suddenly the skies darkened. It started to rain!
choice1: The turtle climbed back into the lake.
choice2: The turtle continued to sit in the sun.

story: Mike used to play intramural volleyball. The one time before the playoffs his friend made a mistake. He jokingly through the ball at his face. Next thing you know his glasses broke off his face.
choice1: Mike was proud of his friend.
choice2: Mike was upset at his friend.

story: A new band wanted for their song to get popular fast. They bribed several radio DJs to play their song all at the same time. When people tuned in the radio, the same song played on all stations. They became a huge success overnight.
choice1: It made them depressed.
choice2: They were very excited about being well known.
